com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.container
Interface ContainerFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
ContainerFactoryImpl
public interface ContainerFactory

Allows for mocking of Class.newInstance() for containers. As of writing, it is not possible to directly mock Class.newInstance(), so this interface may be used as a substitute.

Since containers are a synthesis of types: a parent (container) and child (element), two types are needed. However, due to restrictions in the Java typing system, it is not possible to statically specify a class object having an inner type. For example, ArrayList<String>.class is not allowed. Instead, ArrayList.class is used. To instantiate an instance of ArrayList<String> at runtime only from a Class<?> reference, the result must be cast from the raw type ArrayList to ArrayList<String>. Finally, there is risk for a ClassCastException to be thrown.

This interface is inherently flawed and show be used with great care.

Author:
Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)

Method Summary
<TContainerWithElementType>
TContainerWithElementType
newInstance(Class<?> containerClass)
          Calls Class.newInstance() and casts result.
 

Method Detail

newInstance

<TContainerWithElementType> TContainerWithElementType newInstance(Class<?> containerClass)
                                      throws IllegalAccessException,
                                             InstantiationException,
                                             ClassCastException
Calls Class.newInstance() and casts result.

Type Parameters:
TContainerWithElementType - return type for cast, e.g., ArrayList<String>
Parameters:
containerClass - class object used to instantiate, e.g., ArrayList.class. Must not be null.
Returns:
new instance of class, cast to expected type
Throws:
NullPointerException - if containerClass is null
IllegalAccessException - may be thrown directly by Class.newInstance()
InstantiationException - may be thrown directly by Class.newInstance()
ClassCastException - if cast to type TContainerWithElementType fails for result of Class.newInstance().
